scenario_curator.goal: Transform the human task description into structured scenarios with objects, facts, goals, and any given plans, preserving original intent without fabricating details.

predicate_engineer.goal: Propose a consistent, minimal set of predicates, object types, and argument roles to support the operators and scenarios; reconcile naming so all agents refer to the same concepts.

domain_modeler.goal: Draft lifted operator schemas for the six actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) with precise preconditions and effects aligned with the human description.

private_information: Role: audit temporal/causal consistency across scenarios and proposed operators.
Ensure no bookkeeping shortcuts (e.g., quota tokens, post-hoc penalties) are used to bypass preconditions or effects.
Flag any violated preconditions, unsupported effects, or missing invariants; suggest minimal repairs.
plan_auditor.goal: Validate causal soundness of the operator set against the scenarios; identify contradictions and produce a reconciled, auditor-approved model.

private_information: Coordinate all agents' outputs to produce the final PDDL domain and a problem instance suitable for the FastDownward solver.
Keep actions distinct and faithful to the described semantics.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate scenarios, predicates, and audited operators into a final domain and problem PDDL pair targeting FastDownward.

assumptions: All actions are instantaneous STRIPS-like operators; negative effects remove facts.
Predicates are boolean and closed-world beyond listed facts.
No numeric fluents or temporal constraints beyond causal ordering.

public_information: Available actions over objects: Paltry(x=object_0, y=object_1, z=object_2); Sip(x=object_0, y=object_1, z=object_2); Clip(x=object_0, y=object_1, z=object_2); Wretched(a=object_0, b=object_1, c=object_2, d=object_3); Memory(x=object_0, y=object_1, z=object_2); Tightfisted(x=object_0, y=object_1, z=object_2).
Paltry preconditions: hand(x), cats(y), texture(z), vase(x,y), next(y,z). Effects add: next(x,z). Effects delete: vase(x,y).
Sip preconditions: hand(x), cats(y), texture(z), next(x,z), next(y,z). Effects add: vase(x,y). Effects delete: next(x,z).
Clip preconditions: hand(x), sneeze(y), texture(z), next(y,z), next(x,z). Effects add: vase(x,y). Effects delete: next(x,z).
Wretched preconditions: sneeze(a), texture(b), texture(c), stupendous(d), next(a,b), collect(b,d), collect(c,d). Effects add: next(a,c). Effects delete: next(a,b).
Memory preconditions: cats(x), spring(y), spring(z), next(x,y). Effects add: next(x,z). Effects delete: next(x,y).
Tightfisted preconditions: hand(x), sneeze(y), texture(z), next(y,z), vase(x,y). Effects add: next(x,z). Effects delete: vase(x,y).

Scenario 1 initial facts: cats(object_0); collect(object_10,object_2); collect(object_5,object_1); collect(object_6,object_1); collect(object_7,object_1); collect(object_8,object_2); collect(object_9,object_2); hand(object_11); hand(object_12); hand(object_13); hand(object_14); next(object_0,object_8); next(object_11,object_10); next(object_12,object_5); next(object_13,object_7); next(object_14,object_9); next(object_3,object_6); next(object_4,object_9); sneeze(object_3); sneeze(object_4); spring(object_5); spring(object_8); stupendous(object_1); stupendous(object_2); texture(object_10); texture(object_5); texture(object_6); texture(object_7); texture(object_8); texture(object_9).
Scenario 1 goals: next(object_11,object_9); next(object_12,object_8); next(object_13,object_5); next(object_14,object_7).

Scenario 1 provided plan (for auditing only): clip object_14 object_4 object_9; wretched object_3 object_6 object_7 object_1; clip object_13 object_3 object_7; wretched object_4 object_9 object_10 object_2; clip object_11 object_4 object_10; wretched object_4 object_10 object_8 object_2; tightfisted object_14 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_9 object_2; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_9; sip object_14 object_0 object_8; memory object_0 object_8 object_5; paltry object_14 object_0 object_5; sip object_12 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_8; paltry object_12 object_0 object_8; wretched object_3 object_7 object_5 object_1; clip object_14 object_3 object_5; tightfisted object_13 object_3 object_5; wretched object_3 object_5 object_7 object_1; tightfisted object_14 object_3 object_7.

Scenario 2 initial facts: cats(object_0); collect(object_10,object_2); collect(object_5,object_1); collect(object_6,object_1); collect(object_7,object_1); collect(object_8,object_2); collect(object_9,object_2); hand(object_11); hand(object_12); hand(object_13); hand(object_14); next(object_0,object_8); next(object_11,object_6); next(object_12,object_8); next(object_13,object_6); next(object_14,object_5); next(object_3,object_5); next(object_4,object_10); sneeze(object_3); sneeze(object_4); spring(object_5); spring(object_8); stupendous(object_1); stupendous(object_2); texture(object_10); texture(object_5); texture(object_6); texture(object_7); texture(object_8); texture(object_9).
Scenario 2 goals: next(object_11,object_10); next(object_12,object_6); next(object_13,object_10); next(object_14,object_7).

extract.system_prompt: You structure human task descriptions into explicit scenarios, each containing the object set, initial facts, goals, and any provided plans. Maintain fidelity to the source text and avoid inventing facts or PDDL.
extract.prompt: From the public information, extract two scenarios named scenario_1 and scenario_2 with their objects, initial states, goals, and the given plan for scenario_1. Return them as a concise, machine-readable summary that preserves exact predicate names and argument ordering.

catalog.system_prompt: You design a consistent predicate and typing scheme that covers all operators and facts mentioned. Do not emit PDDL, just a clean inventory of types, predicates, and argument roles.
catalog.prompt: Using the extracted scenarios, propose a minimal set of types (e.g., obj), and a complete list of predicates: hand(?x), cats(?x), sneeze(?x), spring(?x), stupendous(?x), texture(?x), collect(?x ?y), next(?x ?y), vase(?x ?y). Include arities and intended argument roles. Ensure naming matches exactly what appears in the scenarios.

operators.system_prompt: You produce lifted operator schemas in a neutral, implementation-agnostic format (not PDDL text). Keep names and predicates identical to the task description.
operators.prompt: Define the six operators paltry(x,y,z), sip(x,y,z), clip(x,y,z), wretched(a,b,c,d), memory(x,y,z), tightfisted(x,y,z). For each operator, list preconditions and effects with add and delete sets that match exactly the public information. Do not invent additional conditions. Return a structured list suitable for downstream auditing.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency, disallowing bookkeeping shortcuts. You check that each listed plan step (where present) has its preconditions satisfied by the running state and that effects update the state correctly; you also check operator schemas for contradictions.
audit.prompt: Audit scenario_1's provided plan against the operator schemata. Report any step that violates preconditions or relies on unstated facts; suggest the minimal set of corrections to the operator set if a clear omission exists, otherwise keep operators unchanged. Confirm that scenario_2 is solvable under the audited model or highlight why not. Output the reconciled, auditor-approved operators and any minor predicate clarifications needed.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent planning formalization. Produce a final PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem instance targeting the FastDownward solver. Use STRIPS-compatible constructs with types. Ensure predicates and action semantics match the audited model exactly. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Keep action names distinct and identical to the human description.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the audited operators and predicate catalog to create a domain named depots29 with type obj and the predicates: hand ?x; cats ?x; sneeze ?x; spring ?x; stupendous ?x; texture ?x; collect ?x ?y; next ?x ?y; vase ?x ?y. Include all six actions with their exact preconditions and effects. Then create a single problem instance for scenario_2, with objects object_0 through object_14 of type obj; set the initial state to: cats(object_0), collect(object_10,object_2), collect(object_5,object_1), collect(object_6,object_1), collect(object_7,object_1), collect(object_8,object_2), collect(object_9,object_2), hand(object_11), hand(object_12), hand(object_13), hand(object_14), next(object_0,object_8), next(object_11,object_6), next(object_12,object_8), next(object_13,object_6), next(object_14,object_5), next(object_3,object_5), next(object_4,object_10), sneeze(object_3), sneeze(object_4), spring(object_5), spring(object_8), stupendous(object_1), stupendous(object_2), texture(object_10), texture(object_5), texture(object_6), texture(object_7), texture(object_8), texture(object_9). Set the goal to: next(object_11,object_10) and next(object_12,object_6) and next(object_13,object_10) and next(object_14,object_7). Ensure the output is directly usable by FastDownward.
